title: Africa: Angel Investing Events Look Set to Fill Some of the Equity and Mentoring Gaps
text:
Africa: Obama Pokes China Over Africa Deals, Says America's Offers Are Real 
It was followed by Angel Fair West Africa in Lagos in March 2014 which brought together 20 businesses from 4 West African countries with 82 investors. These events were not simply beauty parades but resulted in a small but significant number of deals. 
The Angel Fair Accra will take place after the Africa Technology Summit (3-4 November) on 5 November. The event is being produced in partnership with the Ghana Angel Investor Network. This is sponsored by the Venture capital Trust Fund which is a Government sponsored entity that acts as a fund of funds. 
The majority of the Ghanaian angels investing are either CEOs or entrepreneurs with their own businesses. The format of the event is 10 entrepreneurs pitching to 40 angels or if there are more than 20 attendees, it will be held over 2 days. 
The event is not just focused on Ghana but also start-ups selected out of events including DEMO Africa, Pivot and Seedstar. These events select from the best of available start-ups from Africa's accelerators and incubators. In effect, it's pre-selection and you're getting the best of the best. 
Eric Osiakwan will shortly launch Chanzo Capital to attract investment for start-ups:"The idea is to build on our existing experience of already investing and to look for people who want to invest through me and also to access third party capital". 
So what are three interesting start-ups Osiakwan would pick from the emerging Ghanaian start-up scene:" I'd pick the following... 
Farmerline which improves information access and communication channels for smallholder farmers and agricultural workers. I find them fascinating because they are applying innovative mobile web technology to improve agriculture outcomes. 
Siqueries which helps you analyse and understand your data for improved decision making. They're interesting because they have made Business Intelligence so simple and easy for SMEs to improve their performance. 
eCampus is an online learning platform that provides interactive educational materials (past questions, podcast, video lectures, ebooks, games) for free. They're fascinating because their online learning platform is an interactive mobile web app". 
In addition to the Accra event, African Business Angel Network is holding a series of Angel Investor Bootcamp events in key markets. The Bootcamps will consist of a master-class, expert sessions, the presentation of research material and in-depth case studies. The intended audience is new aspiring investors interested in learning about early stage investing as well as seasoned, experienced investors looking to share best practices and engage with their peers. The Bootcamp Series are organised with the support of the US State Department, VC4Africa, Intercontinental Trust and the LIONS Africa Partnership. 
Lagos - July 31st 
The master-class will be conducted by none other than Candace Johnson, 'investor extraordinaire' and president of the European Business Angel Network (EBAN). The expert sessions will bring together leading investors from across the country and VC4Africa will present key findings of the 'Venture Finance in Africa' research. Participating investors will also have the opportunity to join the SeedStarsWorld event and see 10-12 of the best early-stage startups from Nigeria on stage. The Lagos Bootcamp is organised in partnership with the Lagos Angels Network (LAN) and Lagos Startup Week. 
Nairobi - August 13 
Award-winning 'European Angel Investor of the Year 2015' Brigitte Baumann will run the master-class in Nairobi. Brigitte is a serial entrepreneur, long time Angel Investor and President Emeritus of the European Business Angel Network (EBAN). She is the Founder and CEO of Go Beyond Early Stage Investing and Chairperson of Global Angel Investing group YPO. Also at the event Intellecap will announce the launch of their "Impact Investing Network East Africa Chapter" and share insights on launching and managing angel networks while VC4Africa will present their 'Venture Finance in Africa' report. The Nairobi Bootcamp is organised in partnership with Viktora Ventures and the iHub. 
Cape Town - August 27 
Also known as the Business Angelina or Startup-Grand-Dame, the master class in Cape Town will be conducted by Selma Prodanovic. Co-founder of the Austrian Angel Investors Association, partner of accelerator Superfounders, founder of Brainworks. Selma received numerous awards, most recently the Vueve Clicquot Business Woman Award. The Cape Town Bootcamp will take place during the South Africa Innovation Summit and is organised in partnership with Silicon Cape. Further details of the program will follow.
